required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Antibody Persistence in Children Previously Vaccinated With Infanrix Hexa™ or Infanrix-IPV/Hib™
clinical_study.official_title: Antibody Persistence in Children Previously Vaccinated With Three Doses of Infanrix Hexa™ or Infanrix-IPV/Hib™

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess antibody persistence in infants who received three doses of Infanrix hexa™ (DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib™ (DTPa-IPV/Hib) at 3, 5 and 11 months of age in study NCT00307034.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) and Anti-tetanus (Anti-T).
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject with anti-D/anti-T antibody concentrations greater than (≥) or equal to 0.1 international units per milliliter (IU/mL)

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of Antibodies Against Anti-D and Anti-T
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milliinternational units per millilitre (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-pertussis Toxoid (Anti-PT), Antifilamentous Haemagglutinin (Anti-FHA) and Anti-pertactin (Anti-PRN) Antibody Concentrations ≥5 ELISA Units Per Milliliter (EL.U/mL).
primary_outcome.description: Cut-off values assessed were greater than or equal to 5 ELISA units per millilitre (EL.U/mL) in the sera of subjects seronegative before vaccination.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of Antibodies Against Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN.
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per millilitre (EL.U/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Anti-hepatitis B Surface Antigen (Anti-HBs).
primary_outcome.description: Seroprotection = anti-HBs antibody concentration ≥ 10 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
Concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milliinternational units per millilitre (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Anti-polyribosyl Ribitol Phosphate (Anti-PRP).
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject with anti-PRP antibody concentrations ≥ 0.15 micrograms per milliliter (μg/mL)
Concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in micrograms per millilitre (μg/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs).
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (up to Day 46)
primary_outcome.description: Assessed SAEs include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations ≥ 6.2 mIU/mL
primary_outcome.description: Cut-off values assessed were greater than or equal to 6.2 milliinternational units per millilitre ( mIU/mL) in the sera of subjects seronegative before vaccination.

arm_group.description: Subjects aged 5 years previously vaccinated at 3, 5 and 11 months of age with 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ (DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib) administered intramuscularly in study NCT00307034.
Subjects aged 5 years previously vaccinated at 3, 5 and 11 months of age with 3 doses of Infanrix-IPV/Hib™ (DTPa-IPV/Hib) administered intramuscularly in study NCT00307034.

intervention.description: A blood sample will be taken at 5 years of age, after vaccination in the primary study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who had received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ or Infanrix-IPV/Hib™ in study NCT00307034.
- Subjects who the investigator believes that parent(s)/Legally Acceptable Representative(s) LAR(s) can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female subject aged 5 years at the time of study entry.
- Written informed consent obtained from the parent(s)/LAR(s) of the subject.
- Healthy subjects as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child in care.
- Concurrently participating in another clinical study, at any time during the study period, in which the subject has been or will be exposed to an investigational or a non-investigational product.
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product within 30 days prior to blood sampling.
- Evidence of previous or intercurrent diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, polio, hepatitis B, and Hib vaccination or disease since the study NCT00307034, with the exception of hepatitis B vaccination in the DTPa-IPV/Hib group.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products within the 3 months prior to blood sampling.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition, based on medical history and physical examination.
- Family history of congenital or hereditary immunodeficiency.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the screening the following steps occurred: check for inclusion/exclusion criteria, contraindications/precautions, medical history of the subjects and signing informed consent forms.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa Group
group.description: Subjects aged 5 years previously vaccinated at 3, 5 and 11 months of age with 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ (administered intramuscularly) in study NCT00307034.

group.title: Infanrix-IPV/Hib Group

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) and Anti-tetanus (Anti-T).
outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject with anti-D/anti-T antibody concentrations greater than (≥) or equal to 0.1 international units per milliliter (IU/mL)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-To-Protocol (ATP) Cohort, which included all subjects with blood sample available and who met all the eligibility criteria, complying with the procedure defined in the protocol and with no elimination code assigned.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
